SlipJaq

Sliding login panel using jQuery. More...

Installation internal functions



 slpjq_install_get_config_form ()
 Load up our full module and invoke slpjq_get_config_form().

Detailed Description

Sliding login panel using jQuery.

See README.txt for module usage information.

 The HTML, CSS and JavaScript is based on a work by Jérémie Tisseau:
 http://web-kreation.com/index.php/tutorials/nice-clean-sliding-login-panel-built-with-jquery/

 © 2010 teeny-tiny websites
 http://www.teenytinywebsites.com

 Distributed under the terms of the GNU General Public License, version 3.0
 http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.html

Function Documentation

$  delta = 0,
$  edit = array()

Implementation of hook_block().

Definition at line 88 of file slpjq.module.

References slpjq_get_config_form(), and slpjq_slider_render().

00088                                                                 {
00089   if ($op == 'list') {
00090     return array(array(
00091         'info' => t('SlipJaq - Sliding login panel using jQuery'),
00092         'cache' => BLOCK_CACHE_PER_USER,
00093         'visibility' => 0, // This item is not displayed on the pages in the following list.
00094         'pages' => variable_get('slpjq_disallowed_paths', array()),
00095         ),
00096       );
00097   }
00098   elseif ($op == 'configure') {
00099     $form = slpjq_get_config_form();
00100     // Don't present the full-page option on the block configuration screen.
00101     unset($form['slpjq_display_top']);
00102     return $form;
00103   }
00104   elseif ($op == 'save') {
00105     $form = slpjq_get_config_form();
00106     // Turn off the top display if the block is edited.
00107     // (Yes, this might be confusing, but not as confusing if *both* are selected.)
00108     variable_set('slpjq_display_top', FALSE);
00109     unset($form['slpjq_display_top']);
00110     foreach ($form as $field => $v) {
00111       variable_set($field, $edit[$field]);
00112     }
00113   }
00114   elseif ($op == 'view') {
00115     return array(
00116       'content' => slpjq_slider_render(),
00117       );
00118   }
00119   else {
00120     return NULL;
00121   }
00122 }

slpjq_get_config_form (  ) 

Return the configuration form for admin/settings and block configuration.

We also use this function during installation to set the initial values of our configuration variables.

Drupal variables - We define these Drupal variables for our configuration. See the in-line definitions for details.

  • slpjq_display_top
  • slpjq_title
  • slpjq_image_url
  • slpjq_slide_period
  • slpjq_create_button_text
  • slpjq_disallowed_paths

slpjq_install (  ) 

Implementation of hook_install().

To maximize code reusability, we simply pull in our admin configuration form, which contains all of our variable names and defaults.

slpjq_slider_allowed_here (  ) 

Determine whether or not the current page gets a SlipJaq slider.

If the slider is displayed as a block, this restriction is in addition to any block restrictions

Definition at line 261 of file slpjq.module.

References slpjq_path_begins_with().

Referenced by slpjq_footer(), and slpjq_init().

00261                                      {
00262   static $slpjq_slider_allowed_here;
00263   if (isset($slpjq_slider_allowed_here)) {
00264     return $slpjq_slider_allowed_here;
00265   }
00266   $slpjq_slider_allowed_here = FALSE;
00267   if (user_is_logged_in()) {
00268     // While logged in, we don't display on admin paths.(This is not configurable.)
00269     if (slpjq_path_begins_with('/admin')) {
00270       return FALSE;
00271     }
00272   }
00273   else {
00274     // While logged out, we don't display on these "disallowed" paths.
00275     foreach (explode("\n", variable_get('slpjq_disallowed_paths', array())) as $path) {
00276       if (slpjq_path_begins_with('/'. rtrim($path))) {
00277         return FALSE;
00278       }
00279     }
00280   }
00281   $slpjq_slider_allowed_here = TRUE;
00282   return TRUE;
00283 }
